227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:51): Topic: new telcon times
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:51): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: we have a new participant, Daniel from Google Wave
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:53): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  flexible on new telcom time
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:55): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Send preferences for telcom times to www-DOM mailing list.
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:56): Topic: Mutation Events
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:56): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: useful, pain, not performant
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:56): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: can't deprecate
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:56): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: can put something in place to replace them
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:57): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: shouldn't change the way they work now
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:57): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: bad perf better than breaking content
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:57): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: are all mutation events slow?
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:58): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: will put in spec the ones that perform slowly, use these that operate better
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (21:59): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: JS Ninjas proposed alternate API (maybe from Dean Edwards) watchSelector, mutation event w/ callback based on a filter
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:00): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: probably use cases for this and the mutation events
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:00): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7:  selector based solution doesn't let you watch attributes
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:00): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: workaround: use x path
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:01): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: mostly need to know when one node changes

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:02): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  steve sauders says CSS selectors end up being "malperformant" because people don't realize there are optimal and suboptimal ways of selecting
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:03): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: after dev, will this selector-based solution actually be more performant?
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:06): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: should have conversation on mailing list, if someone can implement it would be great to work on facts

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:06): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7:  could try to harvest feedback on mutation events, if there is a problem we could solve w/ a new performant mutation event we could just add that
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:06): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7:  maybe officially deprecate but wouldn't be obsolete
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:07): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350: agree
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:08): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: two reports from mozilla: we dont have plans to implement DOMsubtreemodified, we might even remove some of the others
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:08): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: probably very small X-browser mutation events
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:08): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: doesn't say we don't include in DOM L3 events

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:09): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: action to start dicuss on mailing list about possible additional solutions that solve the mut. events problem, find existing perf problems and maybe ways to solve them
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (22:09): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-dom/2009JanMar/0007.html
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (22:10): Gecko does support DOMSubtreeModified
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (22:10): I implemented it :p
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:11): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: would love to see more edits of spec as they come
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:11): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: hixie requested more explanation of what each event should do and when it should be fired
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:11): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: next thing to go through and add more detail about the events
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:13): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  jacob: come up with stuff on your own, run things by the rest of team
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:13): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: and doug and the rest of the guys
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:13): Action: d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 to send in proposal from CSS Ninjas

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:14): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  action for d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: send in proposal from the JS (CSS) Ninjas
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:15): Topic: diagrams, because they are pretty
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:15): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7:  did you use SVG?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:16): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/html/DOM3-Events.html#events-Events-flow
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:17): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: added window and made more pretty to events flow
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:17): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: do these events bubble outside windows (like window in window)
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:17): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  they don't
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:17): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  if you have an iframe, it will not leave the iframe
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:18): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: maybe in HTML5, hixie might have provided a way to do that
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:18): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: i think IE does do something like that
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:18): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: one exception maybe, in same domain
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:18): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: should be secure, but shouldn't do it in other scenarios
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:19): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: maybe worth noting events do not bubble outside the window

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:20): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  by default, events do not bubble outside window. Under certain circumstances, a user agent may allow this when it's determined not to be a security risk
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:20): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: jacob needs to look at seamless
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:21): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: unrelated, for svg we're looking at a way to do parameters. for example, a button you want to reuse but alter params.
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:22): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: useful way of messaging things between frames
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:23): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/proposals/d3e-keyflow.svg
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:23): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/proposals/keyflow-gecko.svg
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:25): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  first one may be nice and pretty but not as accurate
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:26): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: first chart attempt at indicating how the text input is generated
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:26): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: I think we need to do the same thing for IEs moddle
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:26): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  please do

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  if we can get b/w IE and Mozilla teams (and maybe Daniel from Google Wave) to provide script library to let people use new model on older stuff and go forward with this new model
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:28): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  rare opportunity to get it right in a majority of languages. will also bring in a intern'l expert in on this.
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:28): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: do we black box it or actually work up an IME model
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:28): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: If there's a great public IME creation system, that would be great

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:29): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Certain points on a slower connection that you might want to only do things after certain chars (like a space after a word in an AJAX lookup scenario)
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:30): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: looks like the FF one is pretty accurate. Need to do some thought analysis on this.
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:30): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  happy to prettify / unify these
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:30): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  would like to include as appendix in DOM3 events for interest in the old models

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 make sure yours is accurate, d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 make a similar one for IE
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  then I will try to unify

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:34): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  and wheel events
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:34): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7:  never closed on line/pixel scrolling

fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:37): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: hoping to get them involved in what they want to see on the web
fcb3799ad9f589cb2f932c5ef1b56ad2 (22:37): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  right now they deal with designers on the desktop, but things are moving to the web
